description.value: The Shugoki makes two melee attacks with its kanabo. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+7]] (+7) to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 ([[/r 2d8 + 4]]) bludgeoning damage.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+7]] (+7) to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 ([[/r 1d4 + 4]]) bludgeoning damage.
Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+5]] (+5) to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 ([[/r 1d8 + 2]]) piercing damage.

The Shugoki throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.
The Shugoki regains 9 hit points at the start of its turn if it has less than half its maximum hit points and has at least 1 hit point.

Whenever the Shugoki has disadvantage on a melee attack roll it makes with its kanabo, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to its Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attack misses but the higher of the two [[/r d20]] rolls would have hit.
The Shugoki cannot be knocked prone by non-magical means. They also have advantage on saving throws against spells or other effects that would force them to move.
If the Shugoki has less than half of its maximum hit points, it has resistance to all damage except psychic damage.
Once per turn, the Shugoki may make one of with their kanabo attacks with a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, they add +10 to the attack's damage.

If the Shugoki hits with the first kanabo attack on their turn, they may make an unarmed strike instead of their second kanabo attack. On a hit, the creature is incapacitated until the start of their next turn.

If the Shugoki successfully grapples a creature, they may use their bonus action to crush the creature in an embrace. The creature takes 14 ([[/r 4d6]]) bludgeoning damage, is knocked prone and is incapacitated until the start of their next turn. The Shugoki regains hit points equal to the damage dealt and ends the grapple when using this trait.

When the Shugoki takes the Dash action they may move freely through another creatures space as long as they are Large or smaller. The creature is moved 5 feet away from the Shugoki and must succeed a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
The Shugoki has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
The Shugoki adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Shugoki must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Medium armor
100 gp, 30 lb.
AC 14 + Dex (max 2)

This armor consists of a fitted wooden chest piece worn with supple leather along with a helmet, pauldrons, gauntlets and greaves; with some variations featuring slats of wood used for reinforcement. Although it leaves the joints relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered thanks to the lightweight material.

The wearer has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
